syllabus:
Studies in Contents and Methods of Teaching Mathematics (II)

Instructors: Fou-Lai Lin   Kai-Lin Yang

I.         Purpose

1.     To know studies on contents and methods of teaching mathematics

2.     To know theoretical frameworks of competence for teaching mathematics

3.     To develop and conduct a study on contents or methods of teaching mathematics

II.       Outline

1.     (2/18)  Introduction

2.     (2/25) Design-Based Research Collective (2003). Design-based research: An emerging paradigm for educational inquiry. _Educational Researcher, 32_(1), 5–8.  
Ellis, A. B., & Grinstead, P. (2008). Hidden lessons: How a focus on slope-like properties of quadratic functions encouraged unexpected generalizations. The Journal of Mathematical Behavior, 27, 277-296.

3.     (3/04) Gibson, S., & Dembo, M. H. (1984). Teacher efficacy: A construct validation. _Journal of Educational Psychology_, _76_(4), 569-582.  
孫志麟（2003）。教師自我效能的概念與測量。**教育心理學報，****34**（2），139-156。

4.     (3/11) Parent, J. S. S. (2015). Students' understanding of quadratic functions: Learning from students' voices. Retrieved from https://scholarworks.uvm.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?referer=https://scholar.google.com.tw/&httpsredir=1&article=1375&context=graddis

5.     (3/18) McClarty, K. L., Orr, A. P., Frey, P. M., Dolan, B. P., Vassileva, V., & McVay, A. (2012). A literature review of gaming in education (research report). _Gaming in education_, 1-35.

6.     (3/25) Mertler, C. A., & Campbell, C. (2005). Measuring Teachers' Knowledge & Application of Classroom Assessment Concepts: Development of the "Assessment Literacy Inventory"  
林沛穎、林昱成（2014）。從三環評量理論探討融合教育之學習評量。

7.     (4/01) 放假

8.     (4/08) Midterm presentation

9.     (4/15) Midterm presentation

10.  (4/22) Pirie, S., & Kieren, T. (1994). Growth in mathematical understanding: How can we characterise it and how can we represent it?. _In Learning Mathematics_ (pp. 61-86). Springer, Dordrecht.

11.  (4/29) Zawojewski, J., Lesh, R., & English, L. D. (2003). A models and modeling perspective on the role of small group learning activities. In R. Lesh & H. M. Doerr (Eds.), _Beyond constructivism: Models and modeling perspectives on mathematics teaching, learning, and problem solving_ (pp.337-358). Mahwah, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, Inc.

12.  (5/06) DeLuca, C., & Klinger, D. A. (2010). Assessment literacy development: identifying gaps in teacher candidates’ learning. _Assessment in Education: Principles, Policy & Practice_, _17_(4), 419-438.  
涂金堂（2011）。從評量的發展趨勢，談教師應關注的評量議題。

13.  (5/13) Zbiek, R. M., & Conner, A. (2006). Beyond motivation: Exploring mathematical modeling as a context for deepening students' understandings of curricular mathematics. _Educational Studies in Mathematics_, _63_(1), 89-112

14.  (5/20) Lesh, R., & Harel, G. (2003). Problem solving, modeling, and local conceptual development. _Mathematical thinking and learning_, _5_(2-3), 157-189.

15.  (5/27) Final Presentation

16.  (6/03) Final Presentation

17.  (6/10) Final Presentation

18.  (6/17) Final Report

III.      Evaluation Method

Discussion: 40%

Presentation: 30%

Paper report: 30%

IV.     Final report: (As a journal paper, 4000 words in English or 8000 words in Chinese)

Research Questions/Review Purposes

Brief Literature Review

Method

Results

Moderator of Each Week

Ø   Posing three critical questions for understanding the articles one week before you moderate class discussion.

Ø   Preparing ppt structuring the content of the discussion materials.

Participants

Ø   Briefly posing your ideas one day before participating class discussion.

Ø   Posing and elaborating one interesting problem for further investigation during classroom discussion.
